column1: We are experiencing an alarming spike in COVID-19 cases throughout the MA 7th and across the Commonwealth.  ✔️ Wear a mask ✔️ Wash your hands ✔️ Avoid groups ✔️ Stay at least 6 ft. apart ✔️ Get tested: https://t.co/iQB3odjTq6   We keep us safe.
When a safe effective COVID-19 vaccine is ready for distribution it must be free and accessible to all.
La pandemia de COVID-19 no necesita ser una sentencia de muerte para las personas y el personal en nuestras cárceles y prisiones estatales. https://t.co/VfXipQU5BD

American families need COVID relief now.  ➡️ $2000 recurring cash payments (that include our immigrant neighbors) ➡️ Rent cancellation ➡️ Eviction & foreclosure moratoriums ➡️ Student debt cancellation  ➡️ Rental assistance ➡️ Support for our small businesses https://t.co/fdIfvXAkU1

Every dedicated janitorial security and food service worker at Harvard—including contracted workers—deserves robust protections during COVID-19. Period.  @Harvard guaranteed these protections to employees and contractors earlier this year and they must extend this policy now. https://t.co/peBvsxSBGG

Young people are experiencing unprecedented trauma in isolation.   COVID relief must include robust resources that meet the scale and scope of the mental health crisis we're facing. https://t.co/tQ8RkvvUQU

A few immediate priorities for the incoming administration:  ✅ Comprehensive COVID relief ✅ Cancel student debt  ✅ Protect our immigrant neighbors  ✅ Reverse anti-choice restrictions ✅ End the muslim travel ban ✅ Decarceration ✅ Declare climate change a national emergency https://t.co/qUzJE4rHnP

Prisons and jails have become hotspots for COVID-19. The only way to slow the spread of the virus is to reduce the number of people inside these facilities.  With the stroke of a pen  @massgovernor could prevent needless suffering and death.  https://t.co/Dh11VTyekJ

COVID-19 is spreading like wildfire inside prisons and jails in Massachusetts and across the country.   With the stroke of a pen @massgovernor could prevent needless suffering and death. https://t.co/z189yIVvHY

COVID-19 is raging at MCI Norfolk and facilities across MA threatening the lives of countless incarcerated individuals and the staff who work there.   @MassGovernor has the power to address this crisis and he needs to use it before more lives are lost. #DecarcerationNOW https://t.co/tp9kxcCd51
Any COVID-19 vaccine must be free and accessible to all once it's ready.

Beating this pandemic starts with following the science. President-elect Biden’s COVID-19 Task Force of scientists doctors and public health experts is an important step in finally stopping the spread of this virus and protecting our communities. https://t.co/4OGsLvaqg1

As COVID-19 cases continue to surge throughout Massachusetts @CityofBoston is urging residents to help stop the spread by getting tested.   Visit https://t.co/OMVpJf7mvH to find free testing sites across the city.

Decarceration is the only way to stop the spread of COVID-19 in prisons & jails and protect the health of folks behind the wall.   New Jersey’s plan to safely decarcerate is a model that should be replicated in MA & across the country. Lives depend on it. https://t.co/Ngo6PFD265

COVID-19 has created unspeakable trauma for our children and these invisible wounds cannot go unaddressed.  We must provide children the care and support they need to heal and thrive. My #STRONGSupport for Children Act would do just that. https://t.co/tXUwnlKQcb

.@MassGovernor you do know COVID-19 spreads during the day too right?   These half-measures are not enough to address the spikes we're seeing across the Commonwealth.  We must do better.  P.S. Extend the moratorium on evictions and foreclosures. https://t.co/I1LhS3BYld
Our COVID response must leave no community behind.    These agencies must act now before it's too late. https://t.co/m8LqhwCA5g

The emergency lending programs overseen by the Fed & Treasury in response to COVID are widening racial & gender gaps not closing them—that's got to change.  @BharatRamamurti & I sent a letter outlining how they can make these programs more equitable. https://t.co/VcDoDsk9Zb

COVID-19 has exposed the deep inequities in our economic system.  Your credit score is your reputation—and without bold reforms our credit reporting system will continue to needlessly punish hardworking people and families. https://t.co/RTEaqVsoS2

COVID-19 is causing unprecedented spikes in death poverty & homelessness intensifying our childhood trauma crisis.   As we work to build a more equitable nation we must provide communities with the appropriate resources to address trauma at its roots.  My op-ed w/ @RepMaloney: https://t.co/pq363vOxjp

.@MikeConnollyMA & @JoeCurtatone are right:  As COVID cases rise in Massachusetts the last thing we should do is evict thousands forcing them into cramped shelters or out on the streets.  @MassGovernor must extend the eviction moratorium now. https://t.co/LpWWGvADLG

Childhood trauma is a public health crisis that has only been exacerbated by COVID-19.  We must pursue responsive trauma-informed policies to support our children families and communities in #MA7 and all across the country.  My bills with @RepMaloney would do just that. https://t.co/80lEYbLMGR
Donald Trump's own @federalreserve chair agrees families need COVID relief NOW.  Do your job @senatemajldr. https://t.co/xe6Tzef5Gw

COVID-19 has ravaged the physical and financial health of communities of color all across our country.  We need targeted intentional relief to ensure those most impacted have the support they need throughout this pandemic and long after. https://t.co/OH4Dyr8zcG

Indigenous communities were denied quality health care long before COVID but the pandemic has only made matters worse.  As we celebrate #IndigenousPeoplesDay & debate a new relief package we must center their needs & ensure they can recover & thrive long after this crisis.
Public transit systems in Boston & across our country are facing service cuts because of the GOP’s refusal to negotiate a comprehensive COVID relief bill. https://t.co/qOgsisaheV

19 of the 20 largest COVID-19 clusters nationally are in prisons & jails.  The most effective way to stop the spread of COVID-19 in these facilities is to prioritize decarceration which is what my & @RepRashida's Ending Mass Incarceration for Public Health Act would do. https://t.co/tIvpPV6PRc

COVID has deeply impacted & stolen the lives of thousands. It didn’t have to be this way.   My heart is with everyone gripped by the fear uncertainty & grief of this pandemic & the failed White House response. I hope the Trumps & WH staff make a full recovery. My full statement: https://t.co/2ULNNcW4xh

“COVID has been difficult enough for restaurants to deal with. Now we’re dealing with irate people basically because we are of Armenian descent."   These kinds of hateful attacks are unacceptable and have no place in Somerville or anywhere else. https://t.co/kIDjW2eSeD

Last week I voted to pass a bill to avert a gov't shutdown which included $8B in food assistance & increased flexibility for SNAP benefits.   #MA7 families are struggling to put food on the table due to COVID-19.   No family or child should go hungry. The Senate must act. https://t.co/LOzqNrqx4C
1 in 3 U.S. families with kids have reported not having enough food to eat.  Families need COVID relief NOW.

Since the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic anti-Asian rhetoric has led to violent and hostile behavior toward our AAPI neighbors.  There is no room for racism or xenophobia in our society. Thank you @RepGraceMeng for your partnership. https://t.co/RC7IJbsIzH

We have now surpassed 200000 COVID-19 related deaths.  This grim milestone is a reminder of the criminal and willful negligence of this administration. There must be accountability. https://t.co/qqt68d5DOT

COVID-19 has wreaked havoc on the finances of transit systems in #MA7 and across the country.   Robust public transit that connects all communities is critical to any just recovery. The next COVID relief bill must include the funding necessary to #SaveTransit.

COVID-19 has created a funding crisis for states and municipalities in #MA7 and across our country that is disproportionately impacting communities of color.   I spoke with @GovTimWalz about the urgent need for emergency federal aid in last week's @FSCDems hearing. https://t.co/DMXp2cr9cr

COVID-19 is spreading rapidly inside prisons and jails nationwide but we have no clear way of knowing just how severe the spread is.  We must collect & publicly report detailed data on COVID-19 in all federal state & local carceral facilities — & I have a bill to do just that. https://t.co/AXeMPgVyiW

In Massachusetts #COVID19 rates are 3 times higher in our prisons and jails than in the commonwealth overall. This is an ongoing crisis that demands bold action.   Our leaders must do more to prioritize decarceration and save lives now. https://t.co/afquhvtzQe

#COVID19 is unprecedented but it’s hard not to see the stark parallels between this crisis & our climate crisis: science denial the impacts of systemic racism & the urgent action needed to save lives & our planet. My op-ed w/ @SenMarkey & @GreenRootsEJ https://t.co/qXvwJkyWuH

As we work to identify & eliminate systemic racism in our country we must ensure our tax laws don't perpetuate racial injustice. That’s why I’ve called on @USTreasury to provide data on racial disparities in our tax code & recent #COVID19 relief funds.  https://t.co/HVD0I8Pe4a

#COVID19 has exposed many of the starkest inequities in our society including the racial injustice facing communities like #Chelsea. Grateful @EPA has heeded our calls for action as we continue fighting to affirm environmental justice for all.  https://t.co/f4prZveuvJ

#COVID19 is a crisis within a crisis for Black people in America. We must ensure that our hardest-hit communities are getting the testing tracing and treatment resources they need to stop the spread of this virus and save lives.  https://t.co/PRpaCi9zea
When a safe effective COVID-19 vaccine becomes available it must be free and accessible to all.  https://t.co/YdU1a00d3W
Please #MaskUpMassachusetts. Free COVID-19 testing is available throughout the state including locations in Chelsea and Everett. Find your testing site today. #StopTheSpread https://t.co/iQB3odjTq6
The safest most effective way to mitigate the spread of COVID-19 in prisons and jails is to decarcerate. https://t.co/FwHToVwQNg

COVID-19 is exacerbating the discrimination that Black and brown patients face from health care providers.  Maternal justice is about access equity and ensuring that every person is listened to and treated with dignity and respect during childbirth. https://t.co/jRsv10ZzX7
FACT: Children can contract COVID-19.   FACT: It's not safe for schools to resume in-person learning. https://t.co/xmqExZ3z4M

We need concrete reliable data on how COVID-19 is spreading in these corrections facilities so we can get resources to them as fast as possible.   That’s why I introduced the COVID-19 in Corrections Data Transparency Act. https://t.co/CDteLrXkfK

Today @SenWarren & I are introducing legislation to require federal state & local correctional facilities to collect & publicly report data on the spread of COVID-19 behind the wall.  We must use every tool at our disposal to stop the spread & save lives. https://t.co/6oTcyHdaqf

Our nation’s prisons jails & detention facilities are among the worst hotspots for #COVID19. We must prioritize decarceration before it’s too late. We also need robust data & reporting on COVID cases behind the wall to fully understand the scope of this crisis.

This is a public health crisis. An eviction tsunami will only worsen the spread of COVID-19.  We need bold solutions that meet the scale and scope of this crisis and keep families safe healthy and housed. https://t.co/3eAKjplWH0
COVID-19 has laid bare the deepest and most entrenched chronic public health crisis plaguing our country: systemic racism. https://t.co/U1dNj7UzcZ

COVID-19's disproportionate impact on Black and brown communities has everything to do with structural racism. These disparities have been codified into law.   If we can legislate hate hurt and harm we can also legislate healing and justice.       https://t.co/1T0rp4HpSP

THREAD: In #MA7 and around the country workers and families are hurting due to the dual public health and economic crises caused by COVID-19. We need bold urgent action but instead the @SenateGOP #HEALSAct abandons our most vulnerable neighbors in a moment of national crisis.

As the US experiences a surge in COVID-19 cases it is imperative that community health centers are provided with the necessary funds to keep their doors open.  We are calling on @SecAzar to immediately reverse course on the decision to exclude CHCs from the PRF. https://t.co/i8R75jd6Gx

The Northeast is struggling with the highest rates of COVID-19 and over 10% of the country's food insecurity but somehow we're only receiving 4% of @USDA's food aid.   This doesn't add up.  @RepMcGovern and I are demanding that these critical resources be distributed equitably. https://t.co/amAPmSAVw2
When a safe effective COVID-19 vaccine is ready to be distributed it must be free and accessible to all.

This administration cannot politicize its way out of a pandemic.  There must be full transparency when it comes to data collection and reporting around COVID-19 and my colleagues and I will continue demanding it. https://t.co/SE5AQdaEso
This should go without saying but when a safe and effective COVID-19 vaccine is ready to be distributed it must be free and accessible to all. https://t.co/AC1y71b3su

In a shameful attempt to hide its incompetence the Trump admin is rerouting important COVID-19 data like racial disparities from the CDC's public database to a private portal operated by political appointees.  The more he politicizes this pandemic the more lives we risk. https://t.co/b2ufzhpWId

The school #Pushout crisis continues even as the #COVID19 pandemic runs rampant.  Our students are living through the emotional & psychological trauma of this unprecedented crisis.  A missed homework assignment should never result in a jail sentence period. https://t.co/iEjG1qWTfl

I am deeply troubled by these reports.   @CDCgov wasn't collecting & reporting racial & ethnic data on #COVID19 patients either until my colleagues & I demanded it.   Racism is systemic & deeply entrenched in many of the institutions meant to protect us. It must be rooted out. https://t.co/I9QkCmlz7R

A president is supposed to take care of our most vulnerable but for the Occupant of this White House cruelty knows no bounds.   We must prioritize decarceration to save lives during the COVID-19 crisis.  I mean those medically vulnerable not Trump's corrupt friends. https://t.co/4CcUuDlaVd

Massachusetts is opening 8 new #COVID19 testing sites including two in #MA7 in Everett and Chelsea.  Testing is free and open to all MA residents.  Visit https://t.co/iQB3odjTq6 to learn more and do your part to #StopTheSpread in our communities. https://t.co/GwSk5TPf0D

#COVID19 is a pandemic within a pandemic for Black & brown communities who continue to see infection rates more than twice as high as those in white communities.   We must ensure our resources are being directed to the hardest hit communities before more lives are lost. https://t.co/xzm4aftALD

When it comes to coronavirus we can’t forget about our most vulnerable.    Prisons are incubators for COVID-19. We must pass my bill with @RepRashida to dismantle mass incarceration as a matter of public health.    Involvement in our legal system should not be a death sentence. https://t.co/NuD9Jdkpvx

As millions of people across our country continue to suffer because of the dual health & economic crises caused by COVID-19 this administration’s focus on ripping health protections away from people with pre-existing conditions is unconscionable.   We must #ProtectOurCare. https://t.co/jYwuGsZPER

I’m proud that Massachusetts now has the lowest #COVID19 transmission rate in the country but as cases surge in other states we cannot get complacent.   Keep wearing a mask remain physically distant & check in on those around you. https://t.co/rcl9zHI1V3

More than 30 veterans at the Chelsea Soldiers’ Home have died of COVID-19. Given the disturbing revelations of malfeasance at the Holyoke Soldiers’ Home @SenWarren @SenMarkey & I are calling for an independent investigation into what happened in Chelsea. https://t.co/CbgavJFaHX

Black & Latinx residents in Massachusetts continue to face disproportionate rates of #COVID19.   This pandemic is a crisis within a crisis for communities of color and I’m fighting for targeted race-conscious policies to deliver the relief they need. https://t.co/zXO6hmiYDD

Chelsea is the hardest hit community by COVID-19 in MA and incidents like this only add to the city’s disproportionate rates of conditions like asthma. We must address environmental housing & healthcare inequities as the racial justice issues they are. https://t.co/g21jQYOavf
Tomorrow I’m joining my partner in good @MikeConnollyMA and activists from across #MA7 for a conversation on housing justice amid #COVID19.   Join us on Facebook Live tomorrow at 1pm ET!

Our bill will tie eligibility for federal funding to the urgent release of medically vulnerable individuals. Involvement in the legal system should not be a death sentence due to COVID-19 and this bill can save lives.   Read more ⬇️  https://t.co/s7vRl6D5Z5

#COVID19 is a crisis within a crisis for communities of color and this administration’s shameful inaction is making it even worse. We need full racial data on COVID cases and fatalities so that we can stop the spread of this virus and save lives now.  https://t.co/jMpidUy0bg

I fought to ensure SNAP recipients in #MA7 can use their benefits online amid #COVID19 but it's unacceptable that these online benefits can only be used on @amazon & @walmart.   I’m calling on @USDA to dramatically expand the number of retailers in the online purchasing program. https://t.co/IpUYHbBypt

We cannot allow our students and educators to pay the price for the economic crisis caused by #COVID19.   That’s why @RepRashida @RepJahanaHayes & I are calling for at least $305 billion in K-12 education stabilization funding for school districts in #MA7 & across our country. https://t.co/DJE9jdP8w1

Getting ahead of #COVID19 requires robust access to testing and treatment especially in the hardest hit communities. Proud to work with local leaders & @BIDMChealth to expand access to testing in #MA7 by securing a new drive-up testing site in #Randolph. https://t.co/ex1DKjRSfC

We need robust demographic data on who’s being impacted by #COVID19 including sexual orientation & gender identity.   Proud to join my colleagues in urging @SecAzar to collect this data & ensure our #LGBTQ+ neighbors get the care & resources they deserve. https://t.co/i5DjWqI3Hm

Our immigrant neighbors many of whom are on the frontlines of the #COVID19 crisis deserve the same relief and protections as anyone else. I’m glad that the Heroes Act included long-overdue access to relief for some immigrant families. Our work continues. https://t.co/m4nRixTto0

Latinx communities across the country have been disproportionately impacted by the #COVID19 crisis. I’m joining @WeAreUnidosUS for an important conversation on the need to center our Latinx neighbors & communities of color in our recovery efforts. Join us https://t.co/sX3V3XScMb https://t.co/bfUP0lkV23

With in-person visits suspended due to #COVID19 @ICEgov must provide detainees with free access to phone calls.   @DHSgov committed to doing so weeks ago and today we’re calling on them to make good on that promise immediately. https://t.co/58Zo8YevCQ

I’m joining @WuWCVB & @EdWCVB #OnTheRecord this morning to talk #COVID19 our federal relief efforts and what more must be done to center our most vulnerable neighbors amid this crisis. #TuneIn to @WCVB at 11am.

Requiring immigrants to report to in-person initial check-ins during the #COVID19 pandemic puts those immigrants immigration officials and entire communities at a higher risk.   @ICEgov must place an immediate moratorium on all ICE in-person check-ins until at least August 1. https://t.co/AObOlkhFav

We need a #PeoplesRecovery. Today I'm co-chairing a @USProgressives hearing on the need to massively scale up #COVID19 testing and contract tracing with @RepRaskin & @repmarkpocan.   Watch live ⬇️ https://t.co/EUfw3tUhLN

🚨Attention #MA7🚨: If you want to receive your #COVID19 relief payment via direct deposit you have until NOON TODAY to submit your bank info. Otherwise you'll have to wait for a check via mail. Update your information ASAP at https://t.co/sB2WeTdT5V

Our next #MA7 Telephone Town Hall is tomorrow night at 6pm ET. Join me and local experts as we answer your questions and provide an update on the federal response to #COVID19. Have a question you want answered? Submit it here ➡️ https://t.co/JFR64FHliM https://t.co/BoP8LvQVlf

Black and brown communities disproportionately bear the brunt of our $1.6 trillion student loan debt crisis and the #COVID19 crisis has only exacerbated these inequities.   @Ilhan @RepAdams & I are continuing our calls to #CancelStudentDebt now. https://t.co/VBv0ik2vPl

Healthcare workers are fighting not only the #COVID19 pandemic but also life-threatening online misinformation. I stand with them in calling on social media platforms to #StopTheInfodemic. https://t.co/DMRZ8KDA1T

Ahead of #FreethePill Day join reproductive health rights & justice organizations for an interactive webinar on #COVID19 and the inaccessibility of birth control today at 2pm ET! RSVP ➡️ https://t.co/NkInTmKxmo https://t.co/bedKHQlVGv

Abortion care is healthcare and it’s unconscionable to block access to healthcare in the middle of a pandemic.  We cannot allow anti-choice lawmakers to use #COVID19 as a pretext to deny reproductive justice any longer. #WeDemandMore https://t.co/URQkIXmDQS

Long-term care facilities are proving to be incubators for #COVID19. As Vice-Chair of the @HouseDemocrats Task Force on Aging & Families I’m fighting to get these facilities the testing #PPE & federal support they need to stop the spread of this virus. https://t.co/MT1275vETh

Black and brown borrowers disproportionately bear the burden of our #StudentDebt crisis and #COVID19 is only making things worse. I’m joining @NAACPYC_ tonight for a conversation on Black student debt and the urgent need to #CancelStudentDebt. https://t.co/xYS3KHVDxM

Prisons & jails are amongst the worst #COVID19 hotspots. Failure to act urgently puts the lives of millions of incarcerated people at risk.   I’m calling on the @NatlGovsAssoc and governors in the hardest-hit states to prioritize #DecarcerationNow before it's too late. https://t.co/7pGY7C87gi

#COVID19 is already exacerbating disparities in healthcare access faced by #LGBTQ+ people. It’s unfathomable that this admin is attempting to make it even harder for them to access care in the midst of a pandemic.   @HHSgov must abandon this deadly & discriminatory policy now. https://t.co/uipDJBK1bt
Our Community Conversation on #Immigration & #COVID19 is starting now! Tune in ➡️ https://t.co/A27IQAvXsx https://t.co/LNJGWDYv7E

Thanks to our efforts @CDCgov is now legally required to collect & release racial data on #COVID19. But we know all too well that this admin can’t be trusted to do right on their own. Today we’re demanding transparency & urgent action from @VP & the CDC. https://t.co/QhT2H5UyJx

Join us tonight on Facebook Live for a community conversation on #immigration & #COVID19. We’ll be talking with experts and advocates from local organizations about the impact this pandemic is having on our immigrant community and what we can do to help. https://t.co/EgIGsfmqKR

As we focus on fighting the #COVID19 pandemic we must continue to hold space for the pandemic of homicide & violence which robs our communities of far too many lives and leaves #trauma in its wake. My Op-Ed with @LDBpeaceInst founder Tina Cherry ⬇️ https://t.co/zujUkJl2dj

People of color in #MA7 are suffering from #COVID19 at disproportionate rates due to generations of systemic inequities. Grateful for the partnership of my colleagues at every level of gov’t as we work to end these disparities & save lives. https://t.co/60RR1epyYv

Looking forward to tonight’s virtual #StreetTalks conversation w/ @StreetsBoston about the mobility challenges posed by #COVID19 & what we can do to ensure equitable and sustainable #transit systems in #MA7 during this crisis & beyond. Tune in at 6pm ET ⬇️ https://t.co/JOxLpqfXYk

Join me @DARollins & @GYamey this afternoon for @nowthisnews and @theappeal's ‘The Briefing'.   We’ll be talking about the urgent need to meaningfully decarcerate public health policy & #COVID19 and much more. Tune in live at 4:30 PM ET https://t.co/jS4xGz9Tsm

Andrea Circle Bear is the 30th person in federal custody to die. This is a preventable tragedy. Every day @OfficialFBOP refuses to decarcerate is one more family robbed of a loved one – one more child robbed of a parent. You can’t social distance in a prison. #DecarcerateNow https://t.co/enimvhmDzw

I’ll be on @BasicBlackWGBH with @CallieCrossley tonight talking about the latest #COVID19 relief package the situation in #MA7 and what needs to happen to ensure equitable access to our relief efforts for communities of color. #TuneIn to @WGBH at 7:30pm!

I’m joining @arobach on @ABC today at 1pm ET to discuss the latest #COVID19 updates in #Massachusetts and the urgent need for federal relief that meets the scale & scope of this crisis and puts people first. Tune in!

Ensuring an equitable recovery starts with understanding who’s benefiting from our relief efforts.   Pleased to see the @federalreserve reserve heeding calls from me @RepChuyGarcia & @RepRashida for greater transparency on where #COVID19 emergency lending funds are going. https://t.co/xiAXvQwGBI

The #COVID19 racial disparities in #MA7 and across the country are the result of generations of structural racism and inequality. We need comprehensive data collection to understand the scale & scope of these inequities and effectively marshall resources to eliminate them. https://t.co/R5Cge0NVdE

.@MassAGO's new website - https://t.co/X8hKfFPt9h - is a one-stop resource for our frontline workers w/ info on #COVID19 testing sites PPE availability emergency childcare options and more. Grateful for her leadership in supporting & protecting our frontline heroes.

Tonight I’ll be joining other policymakers advocates & experts to discuss the Emergency Action Plan: What is it why do we need it and how can you make it happen? How we respond to this #COVID19 crisis will determine the rest of our lives. RSVP now:  https://t.co/PSVIg0YqFL

.@CDCgov is acting on calls from me @RepRobinKelly @RepKarenBass @RepBarbaraLee & releasing some #COVID19 race and ethnicity data – a key first step. I joined @AliVelshi to discuss what more we can do to center the humanity of communities of color and save lives in this outbreak https://t.co/wolpjhTU9S

I'm joining @AliVelshi on @MSNBC this morning to talk #COVID19 our push to get @CDCgov to #ReleaseTheData and the need to center our most vulnerable communities in the federal response to this crisis. #TuneIn at 9am!

🚨BREAKING 🚨  @CDCgov just announced they are heeding our calls to #ReleaseTheData on the race and demographics of #COVID19 patients. This is a huge step forward but there’s still much more to be done to disrupt the inequities that created these racial disparities to begin with

No family should go hungry. As we continue to social distance all families should have access to online grocery services including residents in MA.   This week I joined @RepIlhan on a bill that would expand the Online SNAP benefit to all 50 states. https://t.co/ANeNegieyA

The Equitable Data Collection and Disclosure on COVID-19 Act will require HHS to release daily updates w/ demographic info on #COVID19 cases and establish a commission to make recommendations in real time on improving data collection and responding equitably to this crisis.

We need race-specific data on #COVID19 to fully understand the scope of this crisis & ensure communities of color have adequate access to testing treatment & economic support. Today we’re introducing legislation to require @HHSgov to #ReleaseTheData. https://t.co/iyPcDfYUKp

The #USPostalService provides an essential service to communities in every corner of our country but @USPS is on the brink of collapse due to #COVID19 and decades of GOP attacks. We must #SaveTheUSPS before its too late!  https://t.co/Hx747gsxUs

#ICYMI I joined @craigmelvin this week to discuss the stark racial disparities in the #COVID_19 crisis and the need for race-specific data on testing treatment and fatalities. This pandemic does not discriminate and neither can our federal response. https://t.co/wsaOtQSnUq

Racial disparities in #COVID19 cases are stark. We need all available data to understand how best to combat this inequity head on. Today @SenWarren @SenMarkey & I are urging @CMSGov to release Medicare data on the racial & ethnic breakdown of COVID cases. https://t.co/UwS8yw6TTA
Missed yesterday’s #MA7 #COVID19 TeleTown Hall? Listen to the full call with experts from @HealthyBoston and @BostonLegalAid here! https://t.co/LZYObWcHFc

Join me TONIGHT for a #MA7 TeleTown Hall on the #COVID19 pandemic. I’ll be joined by local experts from @HealthyBoston and @BostonLegalAid to discuss every facet of this crisis and answer your questions. To join the call just dial ☎️ 855-962-1037 at 6pm. https://t.co/qfCsJGMIlX

As we finalize the next congressional stimulus package I will continue to fight to ensure that we center all of our communities & that all federal funding allocated to combat the #COVID19 pandemic recognizes the humanity of everyone who calls our country home. https://t.co/74uGmgUHdP

Joining @craigmelvin soon on @MSNBC to discuss the importance of racial data collection as we continue to mitigate the spread of #COVID19 among all communities especially communities that are most vulnerable to healthcare discrimination

SNAP is one of our country’s most vital social safety nets and it will play a critical role in reducing hunger and keeping families fed throughout the COVID-19 crisis. That’s why my colleagues & I are urging leadership to strengthen & expand SNAP now. https://t.co/OCJHAD8L8W

#ICYMI I joined @rolandsmartin to discuss the Work I'm doing to ensure an equitable response to #COVID-19 including taking into account factors like poverty unstable housing & uninsurance that make certain communities more vulnerable to its spread ➡️ https://t.co/DnwTyGH7qh https://t.co/FVShn6UJIP
